label: 中江藤樹
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1608-48) [Scholar] who correctly understood the essential feature of Chu Hsi's thought [i.e. positing of a universal entity common to diverse circumstances and in the premise that pursuit of the latter is the proper means of achieving the former] and sought to put it into practice.  [Author of] Okina mondō (p. 417). [翁問答]
